question.text:
(i) Anabaena lives symbiotically with Azolla.

(ii) Azotobacter is a free-living N2 fixer in the soil.

Which of the statements given above is/are correct?

solution.text: Anabaena is a genus of filamentous cyanobacteria that exist as plankton. They are known for nitrogen-fixing abilities, and they form symbiotic relationships with certain plants, such as Azolla. Azotobacter is a free-living N2- fixer diazotroph that has several beneficial effects on the crop growth and yield. It stimulates rhizospheric microbes, protects the plants from phyto-pathogens, improves nutrient uptake and ultimately boost up biological nitrogen fixation. The abundance of these bacteria in soil is related to many factors, mostly soil pH and fertility.
